definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: This stour describes two characters from journey to the West.
sentences.chinese: 千里眼和顺风耳是《西游记》中的两个人物。

sentences.english: Latest internet news, webmaster of the eyes and ears.
sentences.chinese: 互联网最新动态新闻，站长的千里眼和顺风耳。

sentences.english: Why do you need to make an appointment with a clairvoyant?
sentences.chinese: 和千里眼见面有必要预约吗？

sentences.english: They are "the eyes and ears" of the higher commanders.
sentences.chinese: 他们都是上级首长的“千里眼，顺风耳”。

sentences.english: The monitors must be forward ears and eyes to the top leaders.
sentences.chinese: 技术侦察兵必须成为高级首长的千里眼顺风耳。

sentences.english: It is said that love is blind but friendship is clairvoyant.
sentences.chinese: 人们常说，爱情是瞎子而友情是千里眼。

sentences.english: I am an excellent obituary writer because I am clairvoyant.
sentences.chinese: 我是一流的讣告写手，因为我是千里眼。

definition: sb with preternaturally good hearing (in fiction)/fig. a well-informed person
nickname of the FAST radio telescope (in Guizhou)
predictable/sth one can predict without being a clairvoyant
to possess great magical power/to possess remarkable abilities
magic mirror for revealing goblins/fig. way of seeing through a conspiracy
lit. to have three heads and six arms (idiom)/fig. to possess remarkable abilities/a being of formidable powers
to prophesy with supernatural accuracy (idiom)/to have an incredible foresight
